data.title: Best Thai in Davis!
data.text: I love the spicy green beans, the larb salad and the Thai fried rice.  The place is very quiet and the staff is shy.

data.title: Basic Thai Food
data.text: Service is ok ... plenty of other choices for Thai food around Davis ... food prep is pretty fast and you can get out of there in less than an hour most days.

data.title: Excellent healthy Vegan options
data.text:
I judge a resturance on if they not only offer Vegan options, but are they healthy?   Yes, on both counts.
You can order fresh veggies with mushrooms and fresh, not fried tofu.

The place is clean, friendly, and attractive.

data.title: A quick random Google of Thai food near us now
data.text: This was a fantastic stop on our roadtrip.  We are always looking to find a good Thai restaurant. And this was truly unique and delicious.  The service was fantastic,  portions large, and very lovely environment.

data.title: Delicious and fresh food in a Thai-feeling place
data.text: After years of dining repeatedly at another Thai restaurant in Davis, I finally joined a friend for a meal here. Now I wish I had gone sooner!  The menu is great, the food fresh and delicious, and the service is perfect.  I love having lunch here, even when it's "crowded" it stays pretty quiet, and the interior of this restaurant will remind you of actually being in Thailand, even if you've never been there.

data.title: Had lunch - Thai fried rice
data.text: The Thai Fried Rice was very good (I had chicken) - my wife had the yellow curry.  The restaurant was clean and the service very prompt.  There was a bit of an odor that I could not quite place (not sure if it was something they had/were cooking, but I had been before and not noticed it) - not pleasant, but not enough for me to walk out.

data.title: best atmosphere, good food
data.text: We have been going here for many years. The Thai wood screen walls and high ceilings alway calms me. The food is basic Thai but well prepared and reasonably priced. Service is very good. Parking always easy on the street or across in the Ace parking lot.

data.title: Great Thai food for your money
data.text: Love the small setting and the decor. The service is prompt and attentive. The food is great especially for lunch its a lot of food. The food came out quickly and hot. I had the red curry spicy and was spot on the heat. Pleas tip the staff well!

data.title: Very Thai
data.text: This Thai restaurant on the corner of G street in Davis is very authentic with Asian inspired decorations and actual Thai waitresses that speak good English. The Spring rolls were a bit bland & lacking spice, however the Pad Thai ordered "medium" had much better flavor.

data.title: Love the mangos!
data.text: My business manager and I wanted to catch a late lunch at KetMoRee in Davis, but they had closed when we arrived at 2:05 pm. Taste of Thai across the street was still open, so we decided to give it a try. They had several lunch specials listed. My manager chose the Mango Paradise, and I went with the Pad Gai, #52, on the regular menu.  We started with the vegetable and tofu soup that is served with lunch and ended up sharing the lunch entrees. The best thing about the Mango Paradise were the mangos.  They were sweet and fresh.  I wouldn’t order the Pad Gai again.  Service was good.

data.title: Spicy, Fragrant, and Delicious
data.text:
An early dinner was served promptly and was well spiced. We asked for dishes to be hot, not Thai hot, and they definitely were.Food was fresh, fragrant and delicious
Service was good, atmosphere ok. Would definitely return on my next visit to Davis

data.title: Give it a try
data.text: There are many Thai restaurants in Davis, but this one has ambiance and a spacious feel.  In addition, the food was very good.  My Pra Ram was very good, though I was surprised the rice was an extra charge as this meal demands rice.  My friend had Pad Thai and was very happy with the taste and the portion.  It was a holiday weekend so special lunch prices weren't available.  We'll go back.

data.title: Fast, Friendly, Fresh and Fabulous
data.text:
Just shared one of the most delightful dining experiences at this downtown Davis establishments.

I had to catch a flight and the staff delivered some of the best tasting Thai food to be had anywhere. They made getting us served a priority and the food came out of the kitchen so fast - so fresh and so delicious, I simply cant wait to return.

Worth the visit.

data.title: Poor service, dorm cafeteria atmosphere, and NO red wine
data.text:
This restaurant is in the Davis 'hood near the U. Several ethnically contiguous joints are nearby. The interior is inherited from some previous joint and is quite pleasant, though incongruous and church-y  - an atmosphere rapidly dispelled by the obliviously indifferent service and poor management.

Basically, don't waste your time. Service was painfully slow, the waitrons did not now what wine was (wine? Genuine puzzlement) until it was repeated to them several times, and then, it turned out that although they had a wine menu, which offered six red wines, they actually had - how many? Four? Two? One? No, NONE in stock. Altogether, I felt as if I was in an alternate reality. We ordered a bottle of mediocre white wine, and it took over fifteen minutes to arrive. Gag me. Ick.

The food, to give it its due, was average. I had the evil prince curry, a cabbage/tofu/broccoli dish with a coconut curry sauce, unexpectedly bland, which was a very run of the mill dish, neither hot nor cold. I would give the food perhaps a 5/10 on a good day. When the waitron came around to refill the water, he did so from the side of the water jug, spilling water over the table. At that point we took it in our stride. We knew full we were dealing with a C minus restaurant.

Why do some restaurants think that service should be the first line of cost-cutting? Why do people continue to patronize these also-rans?

data.title: Look no further...
data.text:
Whenever in Davis, we always look for new and different places to eat.  After a long day on the road, we desired a peaceful, relaxing atmosphere and Taste of Thai seemed to fit the bill.

The room was tastefully decorated in deep wood tones and detailed carvings.  The service was excellent and the waitress reassured us selections would be seasoned to our desired level of spiciness.  That being said, our table ordered a variety of familiar dishes and ate family-style.  Everything was well presented, delicious, and very satisfying.

With restaurants on every corner, look no further than Taste of Thai for your next meal!

data.title: Erste Erfahrung mit Thai Food
data.text:
Wir waren zu viert und hatten ein schönes 3- Gänge Arrangement mit Suppe ,Zwischen- und Hauptgang.
Der Service war freundlich,gut aber auch erfreulicherweise nicht aufdringlich.
Das Ambiente war etwas dunkel und man hatte das Gefühl in einer Kirche oder eher in einer kleinen Kapelle zu sitzen.

data.title: "Tailandês pela primeira vez"
data.text: Esse foi o primeiro restaurante Tailandês que fui e único até o momento e posso dizer que adorei a comida. O local é muito aconchegante para se reunir com os amigos, família e um jantar romântico. O atendimento é bem legal e o nosso atendente teve paciência para nos explicar as dúvidas que tinhamos no cardápio. O preço é ok e os detalhes sobre preços e pratos podem ser consultados no site. É sempre bom usufruir da tecnologia.

data.title: Tailandês
data.text: Adoro comida tailandesa. Já faz um tempo que não vou nesse restaurante, mas a comida deles é boa e com um preço acessivel.

data.title: 穴場的なタイレストラン
data.text: Davisには何件かタイ料理の店があります。その中ではあまり人気のなさそう（いつ行ってもけっこう空いています）な店ですが、意外と美味しいです。お勧めはトムヤンクンとグリーンカレーです。カレーの辛さが選べますが、hotにすると、唐辛子の味がきつくなるだけで、カレーの味があまり楽しめなくなるので、mediumまでにしておいた方がいいです。
